intro: Hibbertia chartacea, commonly known as the paper daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with white centers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has hairy, narrow leaves that help reduce water loss. Hibbertia chartacea is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand salty sea air. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for coastal gardens and conservation efforts.
